body.name: If He Had Been with Me
body.merchantInfo: Ships from and sold by Goodwill of Orange County.
editorialReviews: Editorial Reviews About the Author Laura Nowlin holds a B.A. in English with an emphasis in Creative Writing from Missouri University. When she isn’t at home agonizing over her own novels, Laura works at the public library, where the patrons give her plenty of inspiration for her writing. She lives in St. Louis with her musician husband, neurotic dog, and psychotic cat.

body.description: A New York Times Bestseller*A BookTok Viral Sensation* An achingly authentic and raw portrait of love, regret, and the life-altering impact of the relationships we hold closest to us, this YA romance bestseller is perfect for fans of Colleen Hoover, Jenny Han, and You've Reached Sam. If he had been with me, everything would have been different…Autumn and Finn used to be inseparable. But then something changed. Or they changed. Now, they do their best to ignore each other.Autumn has her boyfriend Jamie, and her close-knit group of friends. And Finn has become that boy at school, the one everyone wants to be around.That still doesn't stop the way Autumn feels every time she and Finn cross paths, and the growing, nagging thought that maybe things could have been different. Maybe they should be together.But come August, things will change forever. And as time passes, Autumn will be forced to confront how else life might have been different if they had never parted ways…Captivating and heartbreaking, If He Had Been with Me is perfect for readers looking for:Contemporary teen romance booksUnputdownable & bingeworthy novelsComplex emotional YA storiesTikTok BooksJenny Han meets Dear Even HansonColleen Hover fans Read more

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on February 2, 2024
reviews.reviewText: This story transported me back to my teen years. So many times I wanted Autumn to say what she felt but she is too young to say what she truly feels. Reading this reminded me of how we grow from adolescent to young adults making bad choices. Or making decisions based on our emotions. We haven't experienced life to make good decisions. Yes I saw the ending coming the very first chapter displayed the accident with Finny not staying in the car. This is how the author captured my attention by leaving a cliff hanger at each chapter. Can an eleven year old fall in love? Or is it their hormones changing? The ending also has a cliff hanger for a second book perhaps.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on February 9, 2024
reviews.reviewText: I dislike when the end is at the beginning. Why??? I read the book anyway, it was a very good basic story line. Shoulda, woulda, coulda until it's too late. Years wasted, when there could have been something. I can't get over how two best friends couldn't say the words to each other. I really liked the characters and could see how people drift apart when we grow into adults.The last paragraph left you hanging. If you spent that much time reading the story, how could the author not write an epilogue?

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on February 14, 2024
reviews.reviewTitle: 5.0 out of 5 stars This is going in the favorites category.
reviews.reviewText: Wow. This book left me gutted in the best way. I was hesitant to pick up a YA style book as I have not been a YA for a while now- but something about this book drew me in. The main characters are wonderful yet flawed. They frustrated me yet gave me hope. I finished this book in 2 days. If you want a quick read and a good cry, this is it.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on February 7, 2024
reviews.reviewTitle: 3.0 out of 5 stars I bought this book for a good cry…
reviews.reviewText: I bought this book because I heard that it was the most heartbreaking book/people were sobbing, traumatized ect…Maybe it’s because I had high hopes that I was so disappointed in the ending?? I felt as if every little detail that was made in this book was rushed, but in a smart way. Like the main characters “novel” that she spent DAYS writing, it was sort of foreshadowing to the point that the end was predictable to me. And there were times that I had to put this book down, not to cry, but because I had second hand embarrassment for the main character😂. There were a lot, and I mean A LOT of “wtf” moments. Anywho, I was so disappointed because the last 30 pages were probably the best and exciting pages in the book, but a rushed ending. If you are looking for a good cry, I recommend “All your perfects” Colleen hoover. :)

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on February 12, 2024
reviews.reviewTitle: 5.0 out of 5 stars the best book
reviews.reviewText: This book has so many feelings. And twist and turns. Reminds me a bit like Romeo and Juliet love story. The ending will wreck you because even though you know it’s happening you don’t want to believe it. I absolutely loved this book. And will have a book hangover from this. (Good thing I have the second one already) LOL

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on February 13, 2024
reviews.reviewTitle: 4.0 out of 5 stars THIS BOOK HAD ME SHOOOOK
reviews.reviewText: the ending is so crazy the only thing I hated about it was that it was a slow burn and I kind of expected wayy more from the book bc it was so long and hyped up but it wasn’t a waste of money. but like if you have watched tell me lies on hulu you will love the book though . It was a good read and 8/10. I would buy it again.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on February 11, 2024
reviews.reviewTitle: 5.0 out of 5 stars too freaking sad
reviews.reviewText: This book literally took my heart, molded it, then stomped on it, and didn’t even try to put it back together. If you love a good book that makes you sob, this is the book for you. All though you know the ending from the jump, it still gives you hope that maybe something will possibly change.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on January 31, 2024
reviews.reviewTitle: 5.0 out of 5 stars keeps you reading!!
reviews.reviewText: I finished this book within 3 days and never put it down of course the exception of sleeping and the bathroom and ect , I usually get bored within 2 pages in but this book? had my attention the WHOLE book and I truly hope there is more to come from this author , if i could give this book 100 stars i would!! even though i cried in the end i still love this book so much !

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United Kingdom on February 10, 2024
reviews.reviewText: The miscommunication in this book was something else. I hated it and I loved it! The real eye opening part was how we all have our own version of events and we never really see the same things. I loved everything about this book except Jamie. Hated his guts and I’m so so glad he never ended up with autumn. Hated Sasha to how could she do that her best friend. I loved autumn and finny and my poor heart was broken by the end of this book. I wanted her to be with him and when it was happening I was cheering from the rooftops. The last page of this book tho had me screaming. How could it end just like that! I immediately brought both books in paper back and I can’t wait to read book 2. This book was everything I never knew I needed to read. I hope future readers feel the same too

reviews.reviewTitle: Heartbreaking story to read but also the most beautiful one
reviews.reviewText: REVIEW IN ENGLISH AND FRENCH🇬🇧 English review :This book completely destroyed me! The ending takes your heart with such surprise, for 400 pages you become attached to Autumn and Finny as if you've known them forever. We see their relationship evolve over the years, the highs and the lows.An unspoken love story that will break you to the very last word.Tip: read with a sad playlist for more emotion! Definitely one of my favourite books!This book completely destroyed me! The ending takes your heart with such surprise, for 400 pages you become attached to Autumn and Finny as if you've known them forever. We see their relationship evolve over the years, the highs and the lows.An unspoken love story that will break you to the very last word. Tip: read with a sad playlist for more emotion! Definitely one of my favourite books!⭐️⭐️⭐️⭐️⭐️ STARS🇫🇷 French review :Ce livre m'a complètement détruite ! La fin vous prends le coeur avec tellement de surprise, pendant 400 pages on s'attache à Autumn et à Finny comme si on les connaissaient depuis toujours. On voit leur relation évoluer au fil des années, les hauts comme les bas.Une histoire d'amour non dite jusqu'au dernières pages qui vous briseront jusqu'au dernier mot. Conseil : à lire avec une playlist triste pour plus d'émotions ! Définitivement un de mes livres préférés !⭐️⭐️⭐️⭐️⭐️ ÉTOILES
